critique: The document establishes a presidential commission to address a labor dispute in the railroad industry. It aims to facilitate a settlement between carriers and employees. It authorizes the commission to investigate, hold hearings, and make recommendations. It directs federal agencies to cooperate and provides funding for the commission's expenses. The commission is expected to submit a final report by December 1, 1961, and will cease to exist 30 days after the report. The order becomes effective on January 1, 1961, with some provisions effective earlier for nominations and fund allocation.
